alert.note: Alert for Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 02 at 10:27AM MDT until November 03 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected between 8500 and 10000 feet, with 8 to 12 inches above 10000 feet in the Tetons. Lesser amounts are expected in the Gros Ventre mountains. Winds gusting as high as 30-40 mph, especially at the higher elevations. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Teton Pass could see 2 to 4 inches by Friday morning, and Togwotee Pass could see 4 to 6 inches by Friday morning. The heaviest snow rates are expected between noon Thursday through late evening Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling, especially on the mountain passes. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
